Get The Examples ⤵️

We’ve all done it,
We’ve all heard it…

Just saying “click the 🔗 to buy xyz” isn’t going to light a fire under someones booty to go buy your offer/product.

Because buying ANYTHING is an emotional decisions.

Yes, that’s right.
Even buying your product needs to spark emotions for someone to hand you their 💳

So stop JUST saying “click the 🔗” And start combining it with their emotional decision!
 
Start with these: [and save them for later ✅]

🔗 Stop [what are they frustrated with?] and finally start [desired outcome]. 

🔗  Empower yourself with [Your Product/Service]! Go to my 🔗 to unlock [Benefit] for yourself!

🔗 Finally ready to [result/desire/dream]? [product/offer] can show you how to __!

🔗  Your [desired outcome] journey begins today, you’re only 5 minutes away from __?

🔗 I bet you’ve never had [type of product] that [benefit], [benefit], & [benefit], until you’ve tried [name of product].

🔗 Ready to make your friends jealous?  You need to get your hands on [product]!

🔗 Hurry! [product] won’t be around long! Get it before it disappears!

Drop a 🔥 if this was helpful!

And don’t forget to share 🫶 this with a friend who sells something on IG!

✌️ Thanks Insta-Bestie

Steal My Viral Strategy⬇️

Step 1️⃣: 
5 minutes before posting, twitch your nose 3x, to activate the algorithm.

Step 2️⃣: 
RIGHT after you post, share your Reel to your stories, make it really small, and then cover it with an 🍆 before sharing.

Step 3️⃣:
You need to be the first person to comment on your Reel, tag the first person in your @ and share one secret you know about them.

Step 4️⃣:
At the 2m mark, you need to cluck like chicken for 30 seconds.

Step 5️⃣:
Within 5 minutes of posting, you need to find your nearest dog (or cat if you aren’t worried about the repercussions) and boop their nose.

Step 6️⃣:
You need to share this with 10 of your friends, otherwise you’ll have bad luck for 7 years on all your future Reels.

It’s not easy,
And it’s a lot of steps,

But this is my super secret Reel strategy that makes all my reels hit 1m views in less than 5 minutes.

If you get it, drop a 😜

Let’s Audit Your Bio ⤵️

You have about 3ish seconds to make a good impression on people when they check out your account.

[share ✈️ this with your friends who need to refresh their bios]

If you want to attract more people to your account,
Your bio should:

1️⃣ State clearly, who your account is for.
This is the type of person you are trying to attract o your account.  Identify them clearly so when they see your account, they know it’s for them.

2️⃣ Why they should follow you.
Most people want to know, “what’s in it for them?”, so tell why sticking around won’t be a waste of their time.

3️⃣ How you serve them.
What’s the ONE THING you really want to help your community do? Think, benefits, achievements, overcoming obstacles, getting out of pain, or how you help them.

4️⃣ What your authority to expertise is.
This is where you shine, tell them what you’re known for, what your expertise is, or what you are an authority in.

5️⃣ What their next step is.
You need to entice people to actually click your 🔗.

Don’t just assume people will click it, you need to give them a reason!

🤫 And the secret tip…
 Instead of wasting what little space you have in your bio with your location,
Use the clickable location tag on your profile by going to 

Edit profile 👉 Contact Options 👉 Add your location.

Having your location on your bio is a great conversation starter,
Even if you aren’t a local biz or service.

5️⃣ Question.
Does your bio answer all 5️⃣? Y/N?

👋 Want an in-depth audit for your bio and learn how you can optimize it to attract MORE people to your account?  Tap the 🔗 in my bio to snag a BIO AUDIT!
 The best part of the BIO AUDIT? I will write your bio for you with keywords and niche targeting statements so you can increase your growth and conversions!

Here’s Why This Matters ⤵️

It doesn’t matter if you’re a content creator, influencer, small biz owner, or just here to grow and be insta-famous…

I’m not going to tell you to comment on the top 5 accounts in your industry to grow,

But I am going to tell you that you need to bring back the SOCIAL in social media.

Heck, the head of IG constantly states that the direction IG is going is to connect people and make it easy to share things they like and enjoy with their friends.

Which is why this checklist is primarily make up of you engaging with others and using your IG like it was intended.

Before you post:

☑️ Engage with 10 accounts on your feed and with 10 people who commented on your last post.

☑️ Respond to any comments you missed on your previous 3-5 posts.

☑️ Make sure you have a CTA + Strong Hook so you post has more potential for engagement.

☑️ Don’t forget to check to see if this is an optimal posting time for you.

After you post:

☑️ Check in on your post and respond to comments.

☑️ Like the comments on your previous post.

☑️ Check your inbox and respond to unanswered DMs.

☑️ Share your post to your story with a CTA that entices people to check it out and bonus points if you add a poll or engagement sticker.
 Let’s use this checklist as a reminder to be social and not just here to post and ghost.

Leave a ❤️ if this was helpful!

This Is Your Sign 👀

To WORK 👏 SMARTER 👏, NOT 👏 FREAKIN 👏 HARDER 👏 

Read that again 🔁

Instead of feeling like you’re constantly having to record new content,
Or feeling overwhelmed when it comes to batching…

Do this instead,
 Schedule time each month to record yourself doing any task that relates to your niche, your brand, or industry.

These task can be the boring-est of boring 🥱 

From:
👉 Folding Laundry
👉 Chatting on a Zoom Call
👉 Chasing your kids around
👉 Drinking coffee/tea
👉 Typing on your computer
👉 Creating/Making/Packaging Products/Offers
👉 Doing your daily skincare/makeup routine

All of these types of content can be paired with a trending audio,
Text on the screen,
A thought out caption,

And it can become a highly engaging, scroll stopping, viral Reel!

Let me prove it to you how easy this is,

Add any video from your camera roll [ideally with you in it],
Use this piano version of Barbie Girl,
Then add text on the screen that says
 “THIS IS YOUR SIGN TO:”

🫶 Send this to someone who needs this sign, and follow along for more!

Are You Sleeping On This 😴

Let’s talk about how amazing Carousel Posts are…

Not only are they frequently featured on the Explore Page [which can lead to growth],
 They also often get shown on your followers feed TWICE,
Yes, you read that right…
 As your community scrolls their feed they will see your first slide of your carousel post,
Then if they don’t engage that first time,
 Later on in the day your 2nd slide will appear as they scroll 🤯

If that isn’t enough to get you to post a carousel…

Then maybe the fact that the Tok has realized how vital photos & swipey posts are to social platforms,
So much so, that they updated their app and added this feature onto their VIDEO PLATFORM 😱

Listen,
Photos are NOT lost on Instagram.

You community still wants to see more from you than just lip-syncs!
M’kay? 
Plus, my favorite part of carousel posts…
 You can batch create 2-4 [or more] at a time using Canva,
Which helps you stay consistent and add carousels into your bi-weekly posting schedule!

Here are some of my favorite Carousel Ideas:
👉 Monthly photo dump
👉 Step by step tutorial
👉 Myth vs Facts
👉 Timeline Evolution of a concept, how you helped a client/customer, or theory.

Are you going to add carousels to your posting schedule?

Oh, and don’t forget,
The last slide of you carousel is the PERFECT place to promote your offer or service 🤑

✌️Happy Creating Insta-Bestie!

5 More Ways To Increase Views ⬇️

But first,
I want to say that the head of Instagram shared that on average you’ll receive 2-4% of your followers viewing your stories daily.
The larger the account, the less the %.

And I want to add that,
The amount of views you receive will fluctuate day to day.  So don’t get too hung up on the numbers, M’kay?

1️⃣ Mix up your content styles by posting videos, photos, templates, boomerangs, etc.

2️⃣ Grab the attention of your viewers by starting your first story of the day with a hook.

3️⃣ Most users have the sound off when they scroll their stories, and because you need to make your content as inclusive as possible, ALWAYS CAPTION YOUR STORIES.

4️⃣ This isn’t shared enough, asking your followers to add you to their favorites gets your content pushed to the top of their feed as they scroll AND sends your story bubble to the front of their queue.

5️⃣ Incorporate content pillars into your story strategy.

This Is Probably Why You Aren’t Growing ⬆️

IG is alllll about how long people stay on the platform,
And they reward the people who create content that keeps people around.

So if you want to increase the amount of time 👀 stay on your account and your content,
Start incorporating these tips:

1️⃣ Hooks & Power Statements
 Not only do you have to HOOK your audience into your video, you need to use POWER STATEMENTS to keep them watching. [Drop POWER if you want my guide].

2️⃣ Movement

Do something with your hands, use a prop, text popping up or insert visuals to keep your audience’s attention.

3️⃣ Covers

Your cover photos need to make it easy for your audience to bounce from video to video, so ALWAYS use a cover photo that has a text HOOK.

4️⃣ Weekly Series
 Start a series that is on the same topic, release these videos on the same day of the week and always give a CTA to watch your other parts.

5️⃣ Edits

Tight edits are where it’s at. Cut out the dead space, deep breathes, or fluff.

6️⃣ Mix it Up

Don’t just post one style of content, start mixing it up between talking heads [like this], trends, etc.  This keeps peoples attention as they binge your content.

And most importantly:

7️⃣ Umbrella Theme

Your content should be easy to consume and FLOW from one to the next.  If you’re all over the place with the topic in your Reels… It’s likely you’ll lose their attention quick because you’re confusing them.

Truth Bomb Incoming, Can You Handle It?

All these people going viral saying that hashtags are ☠️ and that you should focus on keywords and SEO…

DO 👏 NOT 👏 CARE 👏 about you, your business, or your account.
[I said what I said 💁‍♀️]

And they honestly probably have no idea what hashtags do for your content and account in 2023 💣

Hashtags have changed so much since the ole’ IG days where you use 30 tags and your post will go viral, bringing in thousands of random followers.

Just because they’ve changed…
Does that mean you shouldn’t use them anymore?

🙅‍♀️ Helllll to the freakin’ no!

Here’s the deal ⬇️

Is SEO important? Yes.
Are keywords important? Yes.

But get this,
➡️Hashtags are SEO.
➡️Hashtags are keywords.

And hashtags are still a piece of the IG puzzle 🧩

Ready for your perfect hashtag strategy?  Do this ⤵️

1️⃣ Create groups of hashtags that describe your niche, content, account & [if applicable] location.

2️⃣ Don’t stress about the amount, just make sure they are relevant and fit the above perimeters. Test to see how many works best for your account. Just don’t use over 30.

3️⃣ Know what hashtags actually do for your content… 
They won’t make your post or reel go viral, but they will help the algorithm place your content on the right explore pages [🔎 & 🎬].

4️⃣ Realize that hashtags are still being used by your dream followers and customers to find content and accounts they want to follow, engage with, and buy from. 
So every hashtag you use is another opportunity for your post to be seen.

Drop a #️⃣ if you still search and use hashtags!

Oh and before you go,
Help me clear up the hashtag rumors and share this with your friends!

Save & Share With Your Friends!
This is too awesome to keep to yourself!

Have you ever wanted to save your Reels without the watermark so you could share them to other social platforms?

Canva has got you and it’s super easy!

To make the magic happen 🪄 

👉 Go to Canva & search Reels.

👉 Select IG Reels.

👉 Select the blank template.

👉 Go to the side bar and select apps.

👉 Scroll to find Instagram and connect IG & Canva. [FYI: Canva & IG are besties, so you’re all good to connect the two!]

👉 It’ll load all your posts so you can add them to your template.

You could save to your desktop OR you can open the app on your phone and save to your camera roll so you can easily share to other social platforms or accounts.

Let’s Settle The Hashtag Debate ⬇️

Some of the people who create content aren’t doing it with your best interest in mind.

Sometimes they just out for the views it’ll get them to say something controversial about a topic they know is a trigger word for those in their industry.

And sometimes,
These people aren’t experts and they are just sharing information they found on someone’s else’s account,

Believing it as fact because they don’t know any better.

[and because they want the views and their accounts to grow because they see it working for others]

Here’s the deal.
 Hashtags AREN’T what they were in 2016,
Heck, they aren’t even the same as they were just before Reels released.

But this is what we DO know about hashtags and what they do for your account in the 2023 [and beyond] algorithm.

1️⃣ Hashtags ARE Keywords. By adding the symbol in front of a word, it gives you more bang for your buck because not only is the keyword helping the algorithm understand what you content is about, it aids with the 3rd reason you should still be using hashtags.

2️⃣ Using RELEVANT hashtags to your content & account helps the AI determine whose explore page your content should be placed on, if it’s pushed to new people.

3️⃣ AND THE FREAKIN BEST PART!  Using a hashtag makes your content SEARCHABLE 🤯

This is why when “experts” tell you to stop using hashtags, they are hurting you, more than helping you.

Because people still use the search bar on IG and people still search through hashtags to find

📲 Content that want to consume
👩‍💻 Accounts they want to follow
💳 Products/Offers they want to buy

I don’t know about you, but those 3 reasons alone are WORTH USING HASHTAGS!

Right!?!?!

Are You Using Banned Hashtags 👀

Not sure?

👉 I have the easiest way you can check to see if you’re hashtags are on the no-no list!

Search for “META HASHTAG BANNED” in google,
And find the website from my Reel.

Copy and paste your hashtags and have their AI double check your hashtags.

boomshaklaka, easy peasy ✌️

Here’s the deal,
Shadowbanning IS NOT REAL!

BUT,
IG does sometimes filter content if they believe it goes against community guidelines.

Unfortunately some hashtags, even ones you wouldn’t think, are banned.

usually it’s due to icky people sharing gross content to those hashtags…

… and because of those people, IG has to double check all the content being posted that use those same hashtags.

This may mean that if you use a banned hashtag on a post,
That post may not get any traction outside your current community while it’s being looked at.

I know there’s a lot of hype around shadowbanning,
So I want to clear this up,
 Using a banned hashtag won’t hurt the reach of your previous content or your future content.
 Just the one using the banned hashtag, until it passes inspection.

So, use this website, and double check your hashtag groups.

And you’re all good to go!

Read Me ⬇️

DO NOT POST & GHOST!

Why you ask?
Because Instagram is a social platform and they reward people for doing the ONE THING it was created for…

…BEING SOCIAL ON SOCIAL MEDIA!

So instead of posting and setting down your phone 😱

Set a timer for 15 minutes on your phone and do this instead:

1️⃣ Share to your stories [the right way].
 What do I mean by the right way?
Give your story viewers a reason to tap on your post!

You could build it up in the stories leading up to your share,
Add a CTA that entices them to check it out,
Or use the stickers to prep them for engagement.

2️⃣ Go to your previous post from the day before and like the comments. 

This will send those accounts a notification that you engaged with their comment.  This could lead to them coming back to your account or at the very least will get your name in their minds, which could lead to them to going back to your account or watching your stories.

3️⃣ Go to your 3/5 most recent posts AND/OR if you notice a Reel has started to pick up again with views, check to make sure you’ve responded to all the comments.

Keeping up with this shows Algorithm & your community that you care about the comments on your content.

4️⃣ Head over to your DMs and respond to any messages in your inbox.

Start conversations and build friendships with those who are in your DMs.

5️⃣ Engage with your community.

Go to the accounts of the people who engage with your content most,
Watch their stories,
Comment on their content.
Start REAL conversations.

And boomshaklaka!
15 minutes and you’re done ✅.

Drop a 👻 if you promise to never post and ghost again!

Let Me Explain ⬇️

I’ve made some pretty HUGE mistakes building this business and this account and here’s what I’d do if I had to start over from the ground up…

1- I would get crystal clear on my niche, search the heck out the those people, and start creating content with their own words.

2- Start a weekly series, make it something you want to be known for & keeps your audience coming back week after week.

3- Never ever stop learning, being coachable, and investing in yourself. 

4- I would start building my email list with a value packed freebie that lead to a OTO.  That way I could monetize my account right away and get people excited to buy from me because they know the value they’ll get.

5- I would create 3-5 different offers that are at different price points so everyone could afford to learn from me.

6- I would host trainings & give free coaching so I could learn more about my community + give them so much value they would be excited to buy all my offers when I release them.

7- This one is soooo hard for people, but I would stop being jealous of my “competitors” success & start building friendships with them so they would want to Collab with me on Reels, Lives, & Posts.

8- Scheduling time off work & socials will help you in the long run.  I’ve seen so many accounts take weeks and months off (or never coming back) because they didn’t prioritize their mental health.

9- I would stop cringing every time I talked about my offers and start focusing on the good that my offers do for others. Because SELLING 👏IS 👏CARING👏

👉 If you had to start over from 0, what’s the first thing you’d do?

Want This Feeling?

Let’s increase your chance of hitting the explore page in 5 easy steps.

1- Hooks:
As soon as someone scrolls on your Reel, you need to hook your audience in with your messaging & your visuals.

Your text on the screen needs to speak to your niche + the visual needs to grab their attention.

2- Watch Time:
IG cares about the length of time people spend on your content.  After you’ve grabbed their attention, you have to KEEP IT!
 This is where transitions, movements, & POWER STATEMENTS come into play. [drop POWER and I’ll send you my free guide on power statements & why they are important].

The more time people spend on your content, the more the algo thinks your Reel is interesting.  Since it’s an interest based app AND they want people to spend as much time as possible…

Keeping peoples attention so they watch your Reel all the way through, read the caption, and heck- maybe even watch it a second time…
 Will increase your chances of landing on the explore page.

3- Video Quality:
This is HUGE, no one wants to watch a dark or blurry video.  Always make sure to wipe your lens before record & either use natural light or a ring light.

4- Native Text:
This isn’t an IG/Algo thing, but it is a user preference thing.  Use the text that’s inside IG’s editing vs another app like ⏰Tok, or Capcut.

5- Keywords: You caption is SEO, and IG uses the words inside to determine who would be interested in seeing your content.  Make sure to use relevant wording in your caption and relevant hashtags to get the right placement.

While we can’t “hack” the algorithm, no matter what anyone says…
We can use these tips to increase the likelihood of you content being pushed to the explore pages of new people.

Millennials, Do You Do This 👀

I’m calling myself out as much as I’m calling out all my fellow millennials🙊

This little pause has a chokehold on my age group,

But, it’s an easy fix so no one has to know our age 😉😉😉 
Oh, and here are 3 more things us millennials do when creating content:

❌ Starting your Reels or Stories with “SO…”
Starting with a filler word will decrease someone’s interest in consuming your content.

✅ Instead, grab your audiences attention by getting RIGHT 👏 TO 👏 THE 👏 POINT 👏 with your hook!

❌ Saying “HEY GUYS”.
Generalizing your audience actually pushes them away and doesn’t make them feel special, seen, or heard.

✅ Replace this with the “U METHOD”. 

Within in the first 7 seconds of your content, someone should read or hear the word “you, your, yours, or you’re”. This makes your audience automatically associate what they are about to consume, is FOR THEM!

❌ Leaving the walking to/leaning in to stop the recording on your videos.
This is the like the millennial pause, it takes attention away from your message and looks messy.

✅ Always pause after your last sentence or let the audio/lip sync run out, AND THEN reach to turn off the recording.  Trim this little bit out, like the millennial pause, so your content looks cleaner, and much more enjoyable to consume.

Know a millennial? 
Share 💞 this with them so they know the common mistakes millennials are making on Instagram!

Tap To Read More If You Can Relate ⬇️

I know, I know Insta-Bestie,
It can be super frustrating to continue to create content when it feels like no one is going to see it…

…let’s chat about why people are on Instagram in the first place.

Instagram isn’t just an app, it’s a place where people can relax and take a break from their hectic lives.
Plus, IG prides themselves on being a social platform that is based on community and friendships.

Your audience comes here for:
☀️Inspiration
🤝Connection
🎭Entertainment
👩‍🏫Education/Help

So what really keeps people scrolling and watching?

👉It’s content that RESONATES.
Posts that speak directly to their interest, needs, challenges, daily life, and aspirations, will stop someone mid-scroll.

👉Your audience is here for stories that CONNECT.
Genuine experiences and personal journeys that reflect their own.

👉Your audience is here for INSPIRATION that fuels them. 
From fitness journeys, to home makeovers, to small businesses taking over the world…

And, we can’t forget the most important element.

👉A sense of belonging to something BIGGER than themselves.
Friendships, community, and relating to others online, especially when they feel like people IRL just don’t get them.

Before you post again ask yourself these questions:
[save this, you’re going to need it before you post again]

👀 Who is my target audience for this?
👀 What value does this provide them?
👀 Is my message clear & concise?
👀 Does this post encourage interaction or start a conversation?

Struggling With Reach Too? 😩

The people pleaser in me thinks I did something wrong and you hate me…

But in reality, it’s just the time of year.
 Engagement drops between Halloween and New Year due to your audience’s schedule changing, school holidays, and the biggest reason.

Huge companies spending loads of $$ in ads for their holiday deals.

We could be frustrated by the dip or we can use this time to really get to know our communities and step outside of our comfort zones to test out new types of content.

While you’re doing that,
You can try my favorite ways to boost reach and engagement when nothing seems to be working.

1️⃣ Go to your insights and find your best performing post/reel over the last 6 months.  Recreate it and freshen up the caption.

2️⃣ Collab with a friend in your industry with either a Reel or Carousel Post.

3️⃣ Get a group together and host a live room with up to 3 other people on it.

4️⃣ Be honest with yourself, are you being social on social media? 

Instead of posting and hoping they will come, spend 10 extra minutes engaging with others!

Because you can’t get mad about the engagement you didn’t get, with the engagement you didn’t give.

This ONE THING Is Missing From Your Content!

And it’s so freakin simple that you can start doing it, TODAY, on your Reels, Stories, and Captions!

Just think about it,
When someone says ‘you’, your ears instantly perk up, right? 
It’s personal, direct, and suddenly, it’s making YOU the main character.

That’s the power you can tap into when you stop starting your videos with “HEY GUYS”, “HEY EVERYONE”, “HAPPY MONDAY” or a generic hook.
 Instead, you need to get right to the point and grab your audience’s attention instantly with the word YOU!

Simply adding YOU, YOUR, YOU’RE, & YOURS into the first sentence of your video or caption can:

🤝 Turn your general message into a personal conversation.  It’s like speaking to each follower or viewer, directly.  Making your content resonate on a deeper & personal level.

❤️ Increase your relevance & addresses your audience’s wants, needs, & interests, making them more likely to stick around and engage.

🫶 Builds an emotional bond so your audience feels seen, understood, & valued.

🚀 Makes your content more relatable, which will increase your views, comments, & shares!

👀 Keeps your viewers hooked longer, which increases watch time [which IG loves btw] & gives you better chances are reaching the explore page!

So next time you go to create, think to yourself,
“How can I use YOU in the first sentence of my content?”

For example:
❌ People often struggle with __.
✅ Do you struggle with __.

❌ __ can be overwhelming.
✅ Do you ever feel overwhelmed by __?

❌ __ requires__.
✅ Are you ready to __?

[PSST: Share It With Your Friends, they need to hear this today too]

Consistency isn’t about giving 100% of yourself, 100% of the time.
It’s not about posting multiple times a day, or even every day.
 And it’s definitely not about stretching yourself so thing you’re on the brink of burnout.

👉It’s about creating a schedule that fits YOUR life.
One that allows you to have fun, be creative, and enjoy being on social media.

Consistency is about doing one small thing, every single day, that takes you a step, or 1/4th an inch, towards your ultimate goal.

Some days, your consistency might look like giving 37%, or being all in and going at 200mph 🏁
Or it could be taking a much needed nap 😴 and turning off your phone.

Guess what, THAT’S OKAY!

Hustle culture has us believing that consistency is a flawless, unbroken line of productivity, work, and success….
But we’re humans and we can’t possibly maintain that.

So stop trying to pour from an empty cup to keep up with everyone you see on social media.
Because it’s just not possible long term, M’kay?

Let’s Normalize What Consistency REALLY Looks Like,

How to Use These Hacks ⬇️

1️⃣ Holding a prop automatically grabs someone’s attention and pulls them into your content.  Think of it as a visual hook.  This can be a cup of coffee, lip gloss, or even your product.

2️⃣ It’s important to think about our audience and what their hobbies or interests are.  If your audience hates country music, it’s probably not ideal to use country music for your Reels.  I know my community loves The Office, Schitts Creek, and Friends so I’m using audios from those shows.

Or this audio for instance 🤣… who doesn’t love to Get Low by Lil Jon?

3️⃣ The word “YOU” instantly makes your audience feel like the content you create is for them.  It also makes them feel like you’re having a 1 on 1 conversation and sets you apart from the masses.

4️⃣ This one is tricky, but having your text appear on beat vs willy nilly can completely change your Reel.  It’s catchy, more enjoyable and makes your content flow.

5️⃣ Perform tasks with a beginning, middle, & end.  Like curling your hair and showing it done, packaging a product, or even pouring your morning cup of coffee.  This visual story telling keeps peoples interest and has them watching all the way through.

6️⃣ Using short audios that feel like they never ends when you trim your clips to be 5-7 seconds loops your Reel while people are reading the text.

And this one is incredibly important for your talking or long format text Reels,

7️⃣ Power Statements are phrases that grab your audiences attention [when it’s starting to fade] to keep them invested in your content and continuing to watch. [want my free guide on power statements? Comment “POWER” and I’ll send it to you].

Which hacks are you going to start using on your Reels?
1️⃣,2️⃣,3️⃣,4️⃣,5️⃣,6️⃣, or 7️⃣?

Truth Bomb Incoming, Can You Handle It?

You’ve probably seen these quick 5-7 second Reels popping up all over your explore pages. 

They start with a shocking hook that grabs your attention, promising unbelievable results.  Want to know the secret?  You’ll have to read the caption to find out.

Let’s be honest, these Reels are kinda manipulative🤥…

The accounts who create and only share this type of Reel, truly only care about views and going viral, and they often leave you with more questions than answers.
Am I right?

So instead of using the “read caption” strategy for your Reels, let’s focus on a content strategy that helps you grow, build trust, convert, and doesn’t try to “trick your audience” for more views.

👉 Awareness:
These short, relatable Reels offer quick wins, value, or easy action steps to entertain and engage your audience.  While this content is super easy to create, it should NEVER be the only content you create, m’kay?

👉 Consideration: 
Use this content to dive deeper into common problems and solutions, making your audience feel seen and heard and that they are in the right place.

👉 Conversion:
This is your ‘meat and potatoes’ content. It’s where you shine, sharing your brand voice, knowledge, and setting yourself apart in your industry.  This is longer format content, often with you speaking directly to the camera.

You need all three of these content types to cover all stages of your followers journey.
 It ensures that you capture their attention, gives them the value they need, while building trust, and ultimately converts your audience into life-long fans and customers.
 THIS is the secret to sustainable growth and REAL success on IG.

And remember, anyone can make a 5-second Reel for views. 
But if you want to be the go-to expert in your field and build genuine trust, you have do more than create “easy” content.
.
.

Recording B-Roll doesn’t have to be awkward or scary!

All you need is a tripod or you can lean your phone up against your Stanley 🤭

My favorite B-Roll to record:

🎬 Standing in front of walls or backgrounds (make sure they aren’t super busy so your text doesn’t blend into it)

🎬 The walking while holding a coffee in your hand is one of the trendiest and easiest Reels to film. 
A must to film anytime you grab a coffee.

🎬 Filming Transitions for later are clutch when you know you’re on vacation or somewhere that’s not your normal recording background.

🎬 Walking on screen, sitting down, and then walking off screen- is perfect for looping Reels! 

Oh and now that you’ve filmed all these awesome B-Rolls don’t forget this important step:

Save them to your VIDEO VAULT album on your phone so you don’t have to go searching every time you want to post.

Let’s Chat About The Algorithm ⬇️

While *most* people look at the algorithm(s) like it’s their mortal enemy and the reason why their content isn’t performing well,

We are going to start thinking of the algorithm like your bestie, who annoys you by singing off key at the top of their lungs 🤭

And to do that,
You need to know what the algorithm takes into consideration in order to put content on your explore pages and your feed.

1️⃣ Interests:
These are the posts you like, what you comment on, and the content you spend the most time viewing.
They take into consideration the keywords in the caption of that content and the hashtags that creator used.

Remember, at the end of the day, IG is an interest based app.  They want to show you content they believe you’ll be most interested in, so you’ll stay on the platform longer.

So if you’re double-tapping on tons of 🐶 videos, you’re going to see more of your furry friends show up in your explore pages.

2️⃣ Timeliness:
When your scrolling your home feed for content from the accounts you follow,
IG is going to show you the content that was most recently uploaded to the platform.

So the newer the post, the more likely you are to see it when you refresh your app.

3️⃣ Relationship:
This is the accounts you engage with, the people you DM, and those you have a deeper connection with.
 IG takes this as a sign that you enjoy the content they post, and will show you more of it.
 FYI: Relationship will ALWAYS trump timelines.  Which is why you may see your favorite creators post from yesterday at the top of your feed when the post under it was uploaded 5 minutes ago.

👉 Let’s see if the algorithm really knows you as well as it thinks. 
Cuz Best friends should know each other’s likes, right? 😉

Comment with the emoji that best represents what your feed is filled with:

📚 for bookish content, 🏋️‍♂️ for fitness motivation, or maybe 🍰 for your sweet tooth?

Let’s Chat About This ⬇️

Listen,
I’m the QUEEN of copy-paste when it comes to my captions and hashtags from my notes. 

Heck, I even have a shortcut on my phone to easily paste my hashtags in my captions.

I’m also the 👸 of hashtags for myself and my clients.

Some of my top performing Reels have 30 hashtags and one of my clients hit 5m views with 27 hashtags [that’s all that could fit in her caption].

And I have *gasp* deleted posts and Reels in the past 😱

Whether it was from a spelling error, text not appearing on the screen, or I just didn’t feel like the content aligned with my current values…
 I’ve either deleted it, or archived it [my preferred method of removal] and nothing bad has happened 😜

And let’s not forget the biggest viral hack that it is going around…

…adding keywords to your Reel, making them small, and hiding them in your video
🫠🫠🫠

This is called keyword stuffing and a HUGE no-no! 

What I really wish you knew, is that the BEST place to add keywords for your posts and your Reels is your CAPTION!

The head of Instagram @mosseri has said on numerous occasions that the words you use in your caption are SEO [search engine optimization].

The algorithm(s) take into consideration the words in your caption to then place your content in front of the people who either engage with content that uses similar words OR people who search on IG for the words in your caption.

So, here’s my power move: always write a caption, even a short and snappy one that dives deeper into your Reel topic, so you’re guaranteed to use keywords.

It’s like giving your content an express ticket 🎟 to show up in front of the right eyes.

👀Heard something and not sure if it’s true? 

Let me know and I’ll let you know if it’s the real deal or fake news!

Who knew cloning yourself could be so easy?

You can even use the FREE version of CapCut 😱

Directions:
👉 Start by recording 2 separate Reels, save each to your camera roll [remember, DO NOT move your camera after recording the first video].

👉 Open CapCut, start a new project and add your first video.

👉 Scroll on the bottom to find OVERLAY, add your section video & fit it to your screen.

👉 Select REMOVE BG, then tap AUTO REMOVAL.

👉 CapCut will automatically cut you out of the video.

And now there are 2 of you on your screen 🥳

I love using this feature inside CapCut for Reels, Stories, and the “green screen effect”.

Drop a 👯‍♀️ if you’re going to try this!
